  • Arguments
  • View page source

Arguments¶

name¶

Name of the DnnLik object. It is used to build the DnnLik.name attribute.

  • type: str or None

  • default: None

data¶

Input Data object. Either this or the input_data_file input argument should be provided to initialize a DnnLik object and to set the DnnLik.data attribute.

  • type: Data object or None

  • default: None

input_data_file¶

File name (either relative to the code execution folder or absolute, with or without any of the .json or .h5 extensions) of a saved Data object. Either this or the data input argument should be provided to initialize a DnnLik objectand to set the DnnLik.data attribute.

  • type: str or None

  • default: None

load_on_RAM¶

If True all data available in the dataset corresponding to the input_data_file input are loaded into the RAM for faster generation of train/validation/test data. If False the HDF5 dataset file is open in read mode and train/validation/test data are generated on demand. It is used to build the DnnLik.load_on_RAM attribute.

  • type: bool

  • default: False

seed¶

Seed of the random number generator. It is used to initialize the numpy and TensorFlow random state. It is used to ste the DnnLik.seed attribute.

  • type: int or None

  • default: None

dtype¶

It represents the data type into which train/val/test data are converted. It is used to ste the DnnLik.dtype attribute.

  • type: str or None

  • default: None

same_data¶

This option is passed to the DnnLik object by the DnnLikEnsemble object to specify if the same train/val data are used for the different DnnLiks in the ensemble or not. In this way DnnLik object knows how to deal with the corresponding Data object to generate train/val data. It is used to ste the DnnLik.same_data attribute.

  • type: bool

  • default: True

model_data_inputs¶

Dictionary specifying inputs related to data. It is used to set the private attribute DnnLik.__model_data_inputs.

  • type: None or dict with the following structure:

    • “npoints” (value type: list, shape: [n_train, n_val, n_test])

      List with number of train, validation, and test points. The validation and test entries could also be passed in the form of fractions (<=1) of n_train. These will be automatically converted in absolute numbers.

    • “scalerX” (value type: bool)

      If True X input points are scaled with a StandardScaler fit to the train data. If not given it is automatically set to False.

    • “scalerY” (value type: bool)

      If True Y input points are scaled with a StandardScaler fit to the train data. If not given it is automatically set to False.

    • “weighted” (value type: bool)

      If True X input points are weighted (see the DnnLik.compute_sample_weights method). If not given it is automatically set to False.

  • example:

    model_data_inputs = {"npoints": [n_train, n_val, n_test],
                     "scalerX": True,
                     "scalerY": True,
                     "weighted": False}

  • default: None

model_define_inputs¶

Dictionary specifying inputs related to the tf.keras.Model specifications, including the structure of hidden layers with their activation functions and kerner initializers, activation functions in the output layer, Dropout rate, and batch normalization. It is used to set the private attribute DnnLik.__model_define_inputs. The activation functions and the kerner initializers in each layer are specified together with the number of nodes in the layer (see the example below). All tf.keras specifications for the activation functions and kerner initializers are supported. In the case of selu activation the lecun_normal initializer is automatically used and possible Dropout layers are replaced by AlphaDropout ones. In case of activation functions other than selu, if no kerner initializers is specified, then the default one is used.

  • type: None or dict with the following structure

    • “hidden_layers” (value type: list, shape: [[int,str,str],...,[int,str,str]])

      List with hidden layers specifications. All hidden layers in the module are Dense layers. Each hidden layer is represented by a list with number of nodes (int), activation function (str), and (optionally) initializer (str).

    • “act_func_out_layer” (value type: str)

      Activation function for the output layer. If not specified it is automatically set to "linear".

    • “dropout_rate” (value type: float)

      If different than 0, then Dropout layers with the given dropout_rate are added between each pair of hidden layers. If not specified it is automatically set to 0.

    • “batch_norm” (value type: bool)

      If True, then batch normalization layers are added after the input layer and between each pair of hidden layers. If not specified it is automatically set to False.

  • example:

    model_define_inputs = {"hidden_layers": [[300, "selu"],
                                         [300, "relu"],
                                         [300, "selu", "lecun_normal"],
                                         [300, "relu", "glorot_uniform"]],
                       "act_func_out_layer": "linear",
                       "dropout_rate": 0,
                       "batch_norm": True}

  • default: None

model_optimizer_inputs¶

String or dictionary specifying inputs related to the tf.keras.optimizers specifications. It is used to set the private attribute DnnLik.__model_optimizer_inputs. It could be specified either as a string with the name of the optimizer (all default parameters will be used in this case) or as a dictionary with one item of the form "name": "optimizer_name" and all other items specifying parameters related to that optimizer in the form "parameter": value (see the example below). All unspecified parameters are set to their default value.

  • type: str or None or dict with the following structure:

    • “name” (value type: str)

      Name of the optimizer.

    • others

      All input arguments accepted by the corresponding tf.keras.optimizers. For all unspecified inputs default values will be used.

  • example:

    model_optimizer_inputs = {"name": "Adam",
                          "lr": 0.001,
                          "beta_1": 0.9,
                          "beta_2": 0.999,
                          "amsgrad": False}

  • default: None

model_compile_inputs¶

Dictionary specifying inputs related to the tf.keras.Model.compile specifications, including loss and metrics. It is used to set the private attribute DnnLik.__model_compile_inputs. Both the short name and the true name of a metrix are allowed (for instance, both "mse" and "mean_squared_error" are allowed).

  • type: None or dict with the following structure:

    • “loss” (value type: str)

      Name of the loss (either abbreviated or extended). If not specified the user is warned that it will be automatically set to "mse".

    • “metrics” (value type: list)

      List with the name (either abbreviated or extended) of the metrics to be monitored. If not specified it will be automatically set to ["mse","mae","mape","msle"]

  • example:

    model_compile_inputs = {"loss": "mse",
                        "metrics": ["mean_squared_error", "mae", "msle"]}

  • default: None

model_callbacks_inputs¶

List of strings and/or dictionaries specifying inputs related to the tf.keras.callbacks specifications. It is used to set the private attribute DnnLik.__model_callbacks_inputs. Each item in the list could be specified either as a string with the name of the callback (all default parameters will be used in this case) or as a dictionary with one item of the form "name": "callback_name" and all other items specifying parameters related to that callback in the form "parameter": value (see the example below). All unspecified parameters are set to their default value. All tf.keras.callbacks are available, together with the "PlotLossesKeras" callback from the livelossplot package. Arguments specifying output files/folders for callbacks writing to files, that are "PlotLossesKeras", tf.keras.callbacks.ModelCheckpoint, and TensorBoard, are automatically set and the related inputs are ignored.

  • type: list or None

  • list items type: str and/or dict with the following structure

    • “name” (value type: str)

      Name of the callback.

    • others

      All input arguments accepted by the corresponding tf.keras.callbacks. For all unspecified inputs default values will be used.

  • example:

    model_callbacks_inputs = [{"name": "EarlyStopping",
                           "monitor": "loss",
                           "mode": "min",
                           "patience": 100,
                           "min_delta": 0.0001,
                           "restore_best_weights": True},
                          "TerminateOnNaN",
                          "PlotLossesKeras",
                          {"name": "ReduceLROnPlateau",
                           "monitor": "loss",
                           "mode": "min",
                           "factor": 0.2,
                           "min_lr": 0.00008,
                           "patience": 10,
                           "min_delta": 0.0001},
                          {"name": "ModelCheckpoint",
                           "filepath": "this is ignored and automatically set",
                           "monitor": "loss",
                           "mode": "min",
                           "save_best_only": True,
                           "save_freq": "epoch"}]

  • default: None

model_train_inputs¶

Dictionary specifying inputs related to the tf.keras.Model.fit specifications, including number of epochs and batch size. It is used to set the private attribute DnnLik.__model_train_inputs. Both the short name and the true name of a metrix are allowed (for instance, both "mse" and "mean_squared_error" are allowed).

  • type: None or dict with the following structure:

    • “epochs” (value type: int)

      Number of epochs to run.

    • “batch_size” (value type: int)

      Batch size to use in training, evaluation, and prediction.

  • example:

    model_train_inputs={"epochs": 300,
                    "batch_size": 512}

  • default: None

resources_inputs¶

Dictionary specifying available resources. This input argument is assumed to be specified automatically when the DnnLik object is created from within the DnnLikEnsemble one in order to sync resources between the different DnnLiks (see the DNNLikEnsemble object).

  • type: None or dict with the following structure:

    • “available_gpus” (value type: list, shape: (n_gpus,2))

      List of lists with device ID and information of the available GPUs.

    • “available_cpu” (value type: list, shape: (3,))

      List with device ID, specifications, number of cores of the available CPU.

    • “active_gpus” (value type: list, shape: (n_active_gpus,2))

      List of lists with device ID and information of the subset of available GPUs that are active in the current environment.

    • “gpu_mode” (value type: bool)

      True if the current machine has available GPUs, False otherwise.

  • default: None

output_folder¶

Path (either relative to the code execution folder or absolute) where output files are saved. It is used to set the DnnLik.output_folder attribute.

  • type: str or None

  • default: None

ensemble_name¶

Name of the DnnLikEnsemble object of which the DnnLik object is a member. This input argument is automatically passed by the generating DnnLikEnsemble object. If the DnnLik object is not a member of an ensemble, this input should be None (default). It is used to set the DnnLik.ensemble_name and DnnLik.ensemble_folder attributes.

  • type: str or None

  • default: None

input_summary_json_file¶

File name (either relative to the code execution folder or absolute, with or without the .json extensions) of a saved DnnLik object. It is used to set the DnnLik.input_summary_json_file attribute.

  • type: str or None

  • default: None

verbose¶

Argument used to set the verbosity mode of the DnnLik.__init__ method and the default verbosity mode of all class methods that accept a verbose argument. See Verbosity mode.

  • type: bool

  • default: True
